channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Trump's border czar says immigration raids will begin next week, including in Chicago
item.description: Prospects of a raid in Chicago come just a few weeks after Trump's border czar Tom Homan visited the city and threatened to prosecute the mayor if he did not cooperate.
item.content:encoded:
Prospects of a raid in Chicago come just a few weeks after Trump's border czar Tom Homan visited the city and threatened to prosecute the mayor if he did not cooperate.

(Image credit: Jos Edelson)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Trump says he'll likely give TikTok a 90-day extension
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump spoke on the possibility of delaying a ban less than 24 hours from when the social media app is expected to shut down.
item.content:encoded:
President-elect Donald Trump spoke on the possibility of delaying a ban less than 24 hours from when the social media app is expected to shut down.

(Image credit: Beata Zawrzel)
item.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn

item.title: 'The hydrants up here are dead.' Radio traffic shows how LA firefighters lost water
item.description: NPR transcribed more than 2,000 hours of radio communications from the LA fires. It shows hydrants going dry and first responders fighting the fires despite scarce resources.
item.content:encoded:
NPR transcribed more than 2,000 hours of radio communications from the LA fires. It shows hydrants going dry and first responders fighting the fires despite scarce resources.

(Image credit: Brian van der Brug)
item.dc:creator: Nick McMillan

item.title: South Korean court orders formal arrest of President Yoon over martial law decree
item.description: South Korea's impeached president, Yoon Suk Yeol, faces possible imprisonment over his declaration of martial law last month. The formal arrest comes days after he was apprehended.
item.content:encoded:
South Korea's impeached president, Yoon Suk Yeol, faces possible imprisonment over his declaration of martial law last month. The formal arrest comes days after he was apprehended.

(Image credit: Ahn Young-joon)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: With TikTok's future uncertain, creators ponder life without the app
item.description: Barring a last minute sale by its Chinese parent company, TikTok could soon go dark in the U.S. Now, creators on the Chinese-owned platform pay tribute to it — and talk about what's next.
item.content:encoded:
Barring a last minute sale by its Chinese parent company, TikTok could soon go dark in the U.S. Now, creators on the Chinese-owned platform pay tribute to it — and talk about what's next.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: U.S. pays $590 million to Moderna to speed up development of bird flu vaccine
item.description: The public health risk remains low, but bird flu variants have proven to be unpredictable, which is why the virus is a top priority for the federal government.
item.content:encoded:
The public health risk remains low, but bird flu variants have proven to be unpredictable, which is why the virus is a top priority for the federal government.

(Image credit: Plexi Images)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: In India, a police volunteer is convicted of rape and murder of a trainee doctor
item.description: A court found a police volunteer guilty of the rape and murder of a 31-year-old trainee doctor, a crime that sparked protests and hospital strikes amid concerns over lack of safety for women.
item.content:encoded:
A court found a police volunteer guilty of the rape and murder of a 31-year-old trainee doctor, a crime that sparked protests and hospital strikes amid concerns over lack of safety for women.

(Image credit: Bikas Das)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Opinion: Great writers on Los Angeles
item.description: NPR's Scott Simon reflects on the wildfires in Los Angeles, and the words of writers who were drawn to the city.
item.content:encoded:
NPR's Scott Simon reflects on the wildfires in Los Angeles, and the words of writers who were drawn to the city.

(Image credit: Patrick T. Fallon)
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: Readers share wishes for 2025: Be kind to each other and Earth! Learn from birds!
item.description: We asked our readers to make a wish for 2025. If even one of these wishes comes true, the world will definitely be a better place!
item.content:encoded: We asked our readers to make a wish for 2025. If even one of these wishes comes true, the world will definitely be a better place!
item.dc:creator: Laurel Dalrymple

item.title: Beyond red dye No. 3: Here's what parents should know about food colorings
item.description: Food companies have two years to get red dye No. 3 out of their products. But other synthetic dyes have also raised concerns, because of behavioral issues in kids. Here's what parents need to consider.
item.content:encoded:
Food companies have two years to get red dye No. 3 out of their products. But other synthetic dyes have also raised concerns, because of behavioral issues in kids. Here's what parents need to consider.

(Image credit: AdShooter)
item.dc:creator: Maria Godoy
